required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Healthcare Utilization and Outcomes of FinESS Treatment in the Office
clinical_study.official_title: Healthcare Utilization and Outcomes of FinESS Treatment in the Office

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, nonrandomized trial to evaluate postoperative healthcare resource utilization after maxillary balloon antrostomy using FinESS Sinus Treatment in the physician's office.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective, nonrandomized trial to evaluate postoperative healthcare resource utilization after maxillary balloon antrostomy using FinESS Sinus Treatment in the physician's office. Also to demonstrate the long-term durability of FinESS Sinus Treatment performed in an office setting.

primary_outcome.description: The 20-item Sino-Nasal Outcomes Test (SNOT-20) is a validated, disease-specific patient-reported instrument designed to indicate the severity of rhinosinusitis symptoms. The SNOT-20 evaluates 20 symptoms on a scale from 0 ("no problem") to 5 ("problem as bad as it can be"). The overall SNOT-20 score is the average of the 20 symptoms scores providing a range from 0 to 5 with higher scores indicating worse symptoms. The minimal clinically important difference (MCID) has been determined to be a reduction of 0.8 or more in the overall SNOT-20 score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) Nasal Symptoms Domain
secondary_outcome.description: The Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) is a self-administered quality of life questionnaire. Section 1 of the questionnaire scores symptoms related to chronic rhinosinusitis on a 6-point scale with "0" indicating no symptoms and "5" indicating very severe symptoms. There are 4 symptoms domains: nasal, facial, oropharyngeal, and systemic. RSI domain scores are calculated by summing the score of the specific domain question, dividing by the number of domain questions, and multiplying by 20 to obtain a standardized score. Scores can range from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating worse symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) Facial Symptoms Domain
secondary_outcome.description: The Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) is a self-administered quality of life questionnaire. Section 1 of the questionnaire scores symptoms related to chronic rhinosinusitis on a 6-point scale with "0" indicating no symptoms and "5" indicating very severe symptoms. There are 4 symptoms domains: nasal, facial, oropharyngeal, and systemic. RSI domain scores are calculated by summing the score of the specific domain question, dividing by the number of domain questions, and multiplying by 20 to obtain a standardized score. Scores can range from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating worse symptoms.

Section 1 of the questionnaire scores symptoms related to chronic rhinosinusitis on a 6-point scale with "0" indicating no symptoms and "5" indicating very severe symptoms. There are 4 symptoms domains: nasal, facial, oropharyngeal, and systemic. Section 1 of the questionnaire scores symptoms related to chronic rhinosinusitis on a 6-point scale with "0" indicating no symptoms and "5" indicating very severe symptoms. There are 4 symptoms domains: nasal, facial, oropharyngeal, and systemic. RSI domain scores are calculated by summing the score of the specific domain question, dividing by the number of domain questions, and multiplying by 20 to obtain a standardized score. secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Using Nasal Steroids
secondary_outcome.description: The Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) is a self-administered quality of life questionnaire. Section 2 of the questionnaire records medication usage (nasal steroid sprays, anti-histamines, and antibiotics) over the past 12 months.

The Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) is a self-administered quality of life questionnaire. Section 2 of the questionnaire records medication usage (nasal steroid sprays, anti-histamines, and antibiotics) over the past 12 months.

The Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) is a self-administered quality of life questionnaire. Section 2 of the questionnaire records medication usage (nasal steroid sprays, anti-histamines, and antibiotics) over the past 12 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Device and/or Procedure-related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with 1 or more adverse events considered possibly or definitely related to the FinESS device and/or balloon dilation procedure.

arm_group.description: Balloon dilation of the maxillary sinuses using the FinESS Sinus Treatment device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years or older
- Male or female subjects
- Diagnosis of rhinosinusitis (CT radiographic evidence and medical evaluation)
- Willing to comply with protocol requirements
- Able to provide consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hemophilia
- Cystic fibrosis
- Ciliary dysfunction
- Severe septal deviation causing obstruction of the ostiomeatal unit
- Pregnant females

facility.name: St. Cloud Ear, Nose and Throat
Coastal Ear, Nose and Throat Associates

results_reference.citation: Levine SB, Truitt T, Schwartz M, Atkins J. In-office stand-alone balloon dilation of maxillary sinus ostia and ethmoid infundibula in adults with chronic or recurrent acute rhinosinusitis: a prospective, multi-institutional study with-1-year follow-up. Ann Otol Rhinol Laryngol. 2013 Nov;122(11):665-71.

group.title: Balloon Dilation
group.description: Balloon dilation of the maxillary sinuses using the FinESS Sinus Treatment device.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Unable to access sinus with device

baseline.population: All enrolled participants treated with the FinESS Sinus Treatment device.

group.title: Balloon Dilation
group.description: Balloon dilation of the maxillary sinuses using the FinESS Sinus Treatment device.

outcome.title: Sino-Nasal Outcomes Test
outcome.description: The 20-item Sino-Nasal Outcomes Test (SNOT-20) is a validated, disease-specific patient-reported instrument designed to indicate the severity of rhinosinusitis symptoms. The SNOT-20 evaluates 20 symptoms on a scale from 0 ("no problem") to 5 ("problem as bad as it can be"). The overall SNOT-20 score is the average of the 20 symptoms scores providing a range from 0 to 5 with higher scores indicating worse symptoms. The minimal clinically important difference (MCID) has been determined to be a reduction of 0.8 or more in the overall SNOT-20 score.
outcome.population: All treated participants with baseline and 12-month SNOT-20 scores.

group.title: Balloon Dilation
group.description: Balloon dilation of the maxillary sinuses using the FinESS Sinus Treatment device.

measure.title: Sino-Nasal Outcomes Test
measure.description: The 20-item Sino-Nasal Outcomes Test (SNOT-20) is a validated, disease-specific patient-reported instrument designed to indicate the severity of rhinosinusitis symptoms. The SNOT-20 evaluates 20 symptoms on a scale from 0 ("no problem") to 5 ("problem as bad as it can be"). The overall SNOT-20 score is the average of the 20 symptoms scores providing a range from 0 to 5 with higher scores indicating worse symptoms. The minimal clinically important difference (MCID) has been determined to be a reduction of 0.8 or more in the overall SNOT-20 score.
measure.population: All treated participants with baseline and 12-month SNOT-20 scores.

analysis.p_value_desc: Paired t-tests were used to calculate the p-values and evaluate whether the change in outcomes from baseline to follow-up were statistically different from zero. A p value of <0.05 was considered statistically significant.
analysis.other_analysis_desc: A reduction in SNOT-20 score of 0.8 or more is considered clinically meaningful.

outcome.title: Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) Nasal Symptoms Domain
outcome.description: The Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) is a self-administered quality of life questionnaire. Section 1 of the questionnaire scores symptoms related to chronic rhinosinusitis on a 6-point scale with "0" indicating no symptoms and "5" indicating very severe symptoms. There are 4 symptoms domains: nasal, facial, oropharyngeal, and systemic. RSI domain scores are calculated by summing the score of the specific domain question, dividing by the number of domain questions, and multiplying by 20 to obtain a standardized score. Scores can range from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating worse symptoms.
outcome.population: All treated participants with baseline and 12-month RSI scores.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Using Nasal Steroids
outcome.description: The Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) is a self-administered quality of life questionnaire. Section 2 of the questionnaire records medication usage (nasal steroid sprays, anti-histamines, and antibiotics) over the past 12 months.
outcome.population: All treated participants with baseline and 12-month RSI scores.

outcome.population: All treated participants with baseline and 12-month RSI scores. Four participants with blank responses at either interval are considered not evaluable.

group.title: Balloon Dilation
group.description: Balloon dilation of the maxillary sinuses using the FinESS Sinus Treatment device.

measure.description: The Rhinosinusitis Symptom Inventory (RSI) is a self-administered quality of life questionnaire. Section 2 of the questionnaire records medication usage (nasal steroid sprays, anti-histamines, and antibiotics) over the past 12 months.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Device and/or Procedure-related Adverse Events
outcome.description: Number of participants with 1 or more adverse events considered possibly or definitely related to the FinESS device and/or balloon dilation procedure.
outcome.population: All enrolled participants. Participants with unsuccessful procedures (sinus could not be accessed and dilated) were followed for 1 week post procedure. Treated participant are evaluated through 12 months post procedure.

group.title: Balloon Dilation
group.description: Balloon dilation of the maxillary sinuses using the FinESS Sinus Treatment device.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Device and/or Procedure-related Adverse Events
measure.description: Number of participants with 1 or more adverse events considered possibly or definitely related to the FinESS device and/or balloon dilation procedure.
measure.population: All enrolled participants. Participants with unsuccessful procedures (sinus could not be accessed and dilated) were followed for 1 week post procedure. Treated participant are evaluated through 12 months post procedure.

reported_events.time_frame: 12 months post procedure for treated participants. Participants with unsuccessful treatment were followed for 1 week post procedure.
reported_events.desc: Adverse event information was collected on a standardized case report form at each follow-up visit.

group.title: Balloon Dilation
group.description: Balloon dilation of the maxillary sinuses using the FinESS Sinus Treatment device.

event.description: Mild numbness in the treatment area (face, cheek, lip, teeth, eye)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
